title: VR Homes Infra CRM – Colorful Login Theme + Theme-Driven Heading Accents

requirements.summary: Make the Login page background/theme clearly more colorful via theme tokens/CSS while keeping all existing login flows and layout unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: Login screen background (PageTheme variant="login") renders a visibly colorful background (e.g., gradient) in both light and dark mode with no white/un-styled gaps around the viewport.

All existing Login page user flows remain unchanged: Admin/Agent toggle still works, Internet Identity sign-in still works, loading screen still appears, profile setup dialog still appears when required, and agent registration dialog still appears when applicable.
The Login card content remains readable over the new colorful background (text contrast is acceptable in light and dark modes).

file_operations.description: Update theme tokens used by PageTheme variant="login" to a visibly colorful background in both light and dark mode (e.g., gradient-based --page-login-bg), and ensure full-viewport coverage without gaps by adjusting the .page-theme-login background behavior (e.g., no-repeat/cover/fixed as needed) while keeping all existing layout intact.

Keep all login logic and structure unchanged; only adjust styling classes as needed to ensure the login card remains readable over the updated colorful login background (e.g., ensure card surface/overlay and text contrast remain acceptable in light and dark modes).

requirements.summary: Introduce a consistent theme-driven colorful primary heading style and apply it to the Login title and dashboard titles without changing structure or text.
acceptanceCriteria: Login page title ("VR Homes Infra CRM") and dashboard titles (e.g., "Admin Dashboard", "Agent Dashboard") use a visibly more colorful heading style (e.g., accent/gradient text or accent underline) driven by theme tokens (not hard-coded one-off colors).
Heading styling remains readable and consistent in both light and dark mode (no low-contrast heading text).
No changes to routing, authentication logic, backend calls, or role/status enforcement are introduced by the heading styling updates.

file_operations.description: Add theme tokens for heading accents (light/dark) and define a reusable, theme-driven primary heading style class (e.g., gradient text or accent underline) in @layer components so it can be applied consistently across pages without hard-coded one-off colors.
Apply the new theme-driven primary heading style to the login title text ("VR Homes Infra CRM") without changing any text content, layout, or login/onboarding behavior.
Apply the new theme-driven primary heading style to the page title heading ("Admin Dashboard") while keeping the page structure and content unchanged.
Apply the new theme-driven primary heading style to the page title heading ("Agent Dashboard") while keeping the page structure and content unchanged.

Apply the same theme-driven heading style to the app’s primary brand heading in the header ("VR Homes Infra CRM") for consistent heading contrast across the app, without changing any routing/auth/logout behavior.
